goals.question: What is the distribution of housing prices in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of housing prices in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'bedrooms' field against the 'price' field
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District.

goals.question: What is the most common type of property in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of property types in the University District and identify any trends.

goals.question: What is the average square footage of a property in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the distribution of square footage in the University District and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the distance to the nearest bus stop for properties in the University District?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the accessibility of properties in the University District to public transportation and identify any areas that may be less accessible.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='price', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['price'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Median: {data['price'].median():.2f}")
    plt.title("What is the distribution of housing prices in the University District?", wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(data=data, x='bedrooms', y='price', hue='bedrooms', palette='viridis')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the number of bedrooms and the price of a property in the University District?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Number of Bedrooms')
    plt.ylabel('Price')
    plt.legend(title='Bedrooms', loc='upper right')
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax = sns.countplot(x='type', data=data, palette='viridis')
    plt.title('What is the most common type of property in the University District?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Property Type')
    plt.ylabel('Count')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    ax.legend(title='Property Types', loc='upper right', labels=data['type'].unique())
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.boxplot(data=data, y='sqft')
    avg_sqft = data['sqft'].mean()
    plt.axhline(avg_sqft, color='r', linestyle='--', label=f'Average Sqft: {avg_sqft:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the average square footage of a property in the University District?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance_to_bus_stop', bins=20, kde=True, color='blue')
    median_distance = data['distance_to_bus_stop'].median()
    plt.axvline(median_distance, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {median_distance:.2f}')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of the distance to the nearest bus stop for properties in the University District?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Distance to Bus Stop')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
